message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.DC, cs.CY 

The paper deals with a network-based attack that leverages control-plane traffic engineering techniques, making it highly relevant to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. It also involves security and privacy (cs.CR) concerns, as it is a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack. The paper uses data analysis and modeling techniques to evaluate the vulnerability of Internet links, which falls under the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category. The attack involves manipulating the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), which is a core component of Internet routing, making it relevant to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses effective mitigations for network operators, which falls under the Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category.
